text: ETS transcription factors regulate an enhancer activity in the third intron of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
We describe an enhancer site in the third intron of tumor <extra_id_0> necrosis factor alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

A reporter construct containing the 5'-flanking region of the mouse <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene displayed weak activity when transfected into RAW264.7 macrophage-like cells .

text: The addition of the third intron of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to this construct resulted in an enhancement of <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein .

text: This enhancement was eliminated if a conserved 20-bp sequence was removed from the intron or if a dominant - negative ets - binding factor was co-transfected with the reporter gene .
Mutations of this site that destroyed potential ets transcription factor binding sites had reduced transcriptional activity .
The major transcription factor that bound to the oligonucleotide was confirmed to be <extra_id_0> GABP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by supershift and competition analysis .

In RAW264.7 cells , the binding was constitutive , however , in bone marrow - derived macrophages binding activity was shown to be <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inducible .
This may imply a role for ets transcription factors in the production of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
